column4: My crontab not perform commans.when i type crontab -e output is:
You don't need to use sudo -u to acccess your own crontab
Are you expecting something to be in your crontab?
What are you putting into your crontab?
And are you saving the crontab before you exit?
you need to use crontab -e to modify your user's crontab, you cannot use just any editor.
You need to type in the editor that 'crontab -e' opens
put your crontab commands into a file. Then run crontab yourfilename
my type this script in gedit :#!/bin/sh     wget -c http://fs10.filehippo.com/3227/1d22cf1a67334980aa7f1c8461e912a2/ccsetup227.exe matrix
Do you see an editor open when you run crontab -e ?
